ã€‚

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.

Bought day 1 Invasion access, did not get day 1 Invasion access

I've been playing this game for over 7 years and its still fun sure it had that area where they developed absolutely nothing and then over promised things they couldn't deliver and it has the same monetisation system as all other F2P AAA shooters but there are way more positives now that the game is fully out and we know what to expect especially for new players who didn't have to deal with 3 years of nothing.

Over 30 characters to play with unique abilities and rich backstory.
Beautiful Maps and hero designs.
Some of the best looking optional cosmetics in a game.
Cool core game modes to learn.
Workshop to put games you love into Overwatch *as long as you have some coding knowledge.
Awesome arcade game modes.
Pretty good limited time Holiday and PVE events


Also from season 6 forward:
Story Missions (Payed DLC)
Hero Progression/levelling
Hero Mastery Challenges and Leader Boards

This game is probably gonna get review bombed which is unfortunate but this is a honest review for overwatch currently.

I have been playing since OW1....which you can't play anymore since they deleted it and resold it as OW2 with a tacked-on battle pass and item shop. Unlike OW1, character classes in OW2 are designed to force players into their role, forcing them to work with their team, however this whole â€œteamworkâ€ idea falls apart when no one wants to work together, turning most casual matches into a coinflip of who is going to steamroll who. Sadly, this game used to be great but has succumbed to the common trend of taking an established IP and converting it into a mutated lesser version of the Fortnite business model, which only alienates their established userbase. Anyway, Iâ€™m just here to tell you they changed the three heroes I used to main, gave Bastion a hat, and added monetization system. OLD GAME GOOD, NEW GAME BAD.

I miss this game for what it was, not for what it is now 
this game is a complete letdown, they took a good game and gutted it, and then added in a predatory store, they made my favorite role (Healer) the hardest to play flanks go unchecked unless your tank isn't doing their job, and instead defending backline, the removed a tank for no reason and didn't think of the other things it would affect, Im so tired of this I just want to play Overwatch 1 Again but they shut that down didn't they :/
    This game isn't fun, it's frustrating I rather pay 50 bucks and then have loot boxes, than have what this game is now, at least I made friends, to bad we can't play what was once our favorite game anymore

Sad to see the game I once loved in this state, 6v6 was one of the few things that made overwatch a unique experience. Now with 5v5 and the release of overwatch 2 Blizzard brought on the same cookie cutter, battle pass ridden F2P model that does not work with the counterpick/counterplay nature of team fights, where you need certain heroes unlocked to succeed in the meta. With the expected downfall of the OWL and thinning playerbase this game is incredibly unrewarding to play.
